application

Class SignUpValidation

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.SignUpValidation

  • public class SignUpValidation
extends java.lang.Object

    Sign Up Validation Class

    This class is used to validate correct syntax for the sign up details. This class is also used to validate any changes to the customer profile details

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Donal McLaughlin and German Malsagov

      SignUpValidation()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static boolean validateDobStr(java.lang.String dobStr)
      Ensure that the user's date of birth is before today's date
      protected static boolean validateEmail(java.lang.String email)
      The validateEmail method ensures that the user must enter their email address with particular validation rules set using a regular expression Reference for email Regex: https://www.mkyong.com/regular-expressions/how-to-validate-email-address-with-regular-expression/
      protected static boolean validateFirstName(java.lang.String firstName)
      The validateFirstName method ensures that the user must enter their first name with letters only
      protected static boolean validatePassword(java.lang.String password)
      Similarly to the username, the password must be a minimum of 6 characters and contain only:letters, numbers, ".", "_" , "-".
      protected static boolean validateSurname(java.lang.String surname)
      The validateSurname method ensures that the user must enter their surname with letters only
      protected static boolean validateUsername(java.lang.String username)
      The validateUser method ensures that the user must create a username with the correct characteristics: Must be a minimum of 6 characters and contains only:letters, numbers, ".", "_" , "-" .

        protected static boolean validateEmail(java.lang.String email)
        The validateEmail method ensures that the user must enter their email address with particular validation rules set using a regular expression Reference for email Regex: https://www.mkyong.com/regular-expressions/how-to-validate-email-address-with-regular-expression/

      • validateUsername

        protected static boolean validateUsername(java.lang.String username)
        The validateUser method ensures that the user must create a username with the correct characteristics: Must be a minimum of 6 characters and contains only:letters, numbers, ".", "_" , "-" .
        Parameters:
        username - string
        Returns:
        If the username entered is valid, return true. If not valid, return false with an alert.

        Returns:
